name: Inntel Hotels Amsterdam Centre

reviews.text: Solid hotel 5-7 mins' walk from Centraal Station in a lively area. The hotel itself is just off the main road, so reasonably quiet, though soundproofing could be better. Just off the Nieuwendijk shopping street and a short walk to Dam Square or most other attractions in the city. Rooms and bathrooms are small but not tiny, acceptable for a hotel in this location. Wifi is free, all the staff I met were friendly and helpful. Not the most luxurious place, but nothing to complain about and a great choice if you get a decent price.
reviews.title: Good hotel, Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just getting round to reviewing this hotel as we stayed there for a long weekend in August. We chose to stay at the hotel because of the reviews and were let down. We booked a twin room for ourselves and another for our friend this was all that was available. For some reason he managed to get a double bed when there were 2 of us as a couple in 2 single beds. We found this odd so asked reception why put 1 person in a double and 2 in the single beds, the receptionist shrugged and said the hotel was full and could do nothing about it. We booked the deluxe room, there was nothing deluxe about it, which turned out to be a standard room with poor shower, threadbare towels and industrial grade toilet paper. Not the quality we have come to expect of 4* hotels.
reviews.title: Average experience for a 4* hotel.

reviews.text: Thankfully the next morning the manager offered us a bigger room, possibly the superior which was much more comfortable and over all much more pleasant. Staff came in to make up and clean the room, however it was never really cleaned properly and the bedding looked as though it was not changed in 4 nights. Now, if this was their effort to help the environment I understand, but why did the cleaner turn the air conditioning up full everyday. Cups were also not being removed and hairs that did not belong to us gathered in the bathroom. The staff were never overly helpful but usually friendly. We didn't have breakfast included, but were informed that it was nothing special and not worth the money.
reviews.title: Las two nights on business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The saving grace for this hotel is the location; it's perfect for almost everything. We walked everywhere from here, there are plenty of places to have breakfast, lunch and dinner and loads of places to go for a drink. If you have a smart phone download the Tripadvisor app to the city, it's really handy.
reviews.title: It was fine but nothing special

reviews.text: Stayed on Wednesday & Thursday nights on business booked by company. Check in was OK but could have been better at least they had some inter company info from our stay in the same chain/group in Zaandam on Monday. Some of the hotel is across the lane so you have to take one lift and then cross to the other side and take another. I was on the 5th floor and had a direct lift. Rooms were smaller than the Zaandam hotel. Bathroom much smaller too.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay (Dave uk)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not the best hotel ever but not to bad. Price was quite expensive as we wanted a deluxe room, which was a good size and clean and moder. I am glad we did this as the reviews are not the best with the smaller rooms. Staff were very nice and helpful. Did not have breakfast included which was disappointing. Hotel very close to everything walking distance to train station and red light district. Some great things to do in amsterdam we had an enjoyable time. Would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: DECENT HOTEL

reviews.text: Locationwise, this hotel is unique. Just in between of centre of the city and railway station.
reviews.title: Very Good
Good overall
reviews.text: Overall we had a good stay at this hotel, located an easy 5 minute walk from Amsterdam Centraal train station. The lobby and staff were nice, but the rooms were small and outdated. Additionally, the layout of the hotel is quite odd and we had to take two elevators to get to our room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These gripes are quite minor, and the easy accessibility to the city make this a good hotel. Note that while the red light district is close, this hotel is not technically it if that is a concern of yours. It is just a few minutes away however.
reviews.title: nice central hotel

reviews.text: There are also some cafes/restaurants with lots of outdoor seating right in front of the hotel which make for a great place to have a drink before turning in for the night.
reviews.title: Great location, average breatkfest

reviews.text: The location is good for shopping and plenty of public transportation for museum visits. A variety of eating places surround the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a full buffet for both European and American style. I stayed a week and had a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Good location with a helpful staff
Expensive Breakfast
reviews.text: Nice hotel with on and off WiFi service.Expedia/Hotel didn't tell us breakfast wasn't included and we were presented with a bill for 70 Euros when we left!
Would stay there again but would go out for breakfast!!
reviews.title: Great hotel, clean, comfy and modern!

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, and had a lovely time exploring Amsterdam, and then retreating to our room. We booked a superior room on one of the Dutch booking websites to get the best price, and were not disappointed.
reviews.title: inntel is great
A Great Place!
reviews.text: The staff are polite and welcoming, with very good service.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location for transport
reviews.text: The hotel was gorgeous when we walked in, the lobby looked lovely and the drinks there were really not that expensive (there was mulled wine for only 2 euros, but that was the cheapest [the rest were beween 3.50-6.50).

It's very close to the station (about 5 mins) from Amsterdam Centraal. Once you leave the station (on the side where to get the trams), just walk straight down (Niewezijds Voorburgwal) and it is on your left hand side. It's it's got another name, so just in case you think you've got the wrong one, you haven't. There is a square of trees and nearby a Betty Boop shaped sign.
reviews.title: A gem of a place!
Great location
reviews.text: As for someone mentioning it's in a dodgy area, Amsterdam is one of the safest places in the world, I really doubt you'd have to worry.
Anyway, the staff were very polite. However, I wouldn't say that the rooms were amazing for a 4 star. I would say it would be a 3 1/2, nice, but I've been in classier ones.
reviews.title: Its all about location

reviews.text: Also, when they say sattelite, some is pay TV (for the movie channels and a couple of dodgy, dirty ones [you have been warned]), but there are a few (4 or 5 English channels [2 including BBC1 and BBC2]).
reviews.title: Great Hotel, recommended
Excellent hotel
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Golden Tulip Hotel Inntel Amsterdam Centre for 3 nights. Got an excellent deal for hotel only with Thomson Citybreaks, paid £208 for the 3 nights which included breakfast and taxes (it was on a 3 nights for the price of 2 offer for the dates we chose). We cannot fault this hotel. When we arrived we were asked if we wanted twin beds or a double and a smoking or non smoking room. We chose double non smoking and when we were given our room number we were told we had been given an upgrade, free of charge. The room was lovely. It was modern, nicely furnished and spotlessly clean and the bed was at least king size, if not superking and really comfortable. In fact I think it's the most comfortable hotel bed we have ever slept in. The bathroom was equally impressive with nice toiletries! Also there is a safe in the wardrobe which is free of charge so you don't have to carry all your valuables with you while you're sightseeing. The breakfast is good with all the usual continental choices plus eggs bacon sausages etc.Lovely coffee! As for the staff, they were all friendly and helpful without exception. (In fact everywhere we went we found the people to be really nice.) The location is good too.
Would we stay there again? Definitely! and we would recommend it to friends without hesitation.
reviews.title: A1 Location, good hotel...
Had a wkd time!!
reviews.text: I stayed here just after Christmas for a few nights, last year (2004), and enjoyed the stay. Clean, large rooms with all mod cons, roomy bathroom, everything you need. BBC1&2 from memory as well. Staff were friendly, the only complaint I had was the cost of the breakfast was insane - something like EUR12-14 for what was essentially toast & scrambled eggs or cereal. Great location, only a short walk from the station, and on a quiet side street just off the main road with trams to the places towards the south of the city (museums etc.). I would recommend this hotel readily.

reviews.title: overated
reviews.text: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for my bf's bday 2/12/05 to 4/12/05. Hotel very posh lovely room and lovely entrance and also the hotel bar was very nice with open fire burning away. Bed was massive. Very pleased would recommend as its near everything and would defo stay here again.

great location. Just a few minutes walk from the station. Rooms were lovely and big, shower and bath as well. A huge bed, which we discovered were actualy 2 single beds pushed together. I discovered this during the night when i woke up and found my leg was missing but had actualy fallen down between the beds! Overall the hotel was spotlessly clean, however, after the first night i discovered the blanket on the bed was covered in brown stains from top to bottom. The housekeeper who was very friendly and helpful, changed it straightaway. I mentioned it to reception and said I was not very happy about it. They informed me they would look into it but it was never mentioned again! whilst checking out I was even asked to pay 4 euros for the bottle of water i had consumed from the minibar!!!! Reception staff were helpful however the staff at breakfast were very unhelpful.
reviews.title: Good location, quiet, easy from station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel last minute and it did not disappoint. It is walking distance to Central Station, Dam Square, Ann Frank Musuem, restaurants, bars etc. The tram is also outside of the hotel. You can rent bikes next door and catch a canal tour close to Central Station as well. Our room was nice, clean and comfortable. The staff were also kind and helpful with any questions we had. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It's a good value for the money.
reviews.title: Great Location, nice room

reviews.text: We booked the "surprise me" package three months in advance. We arrived at the hotel around 6pm and checked in and was put in this tiny one-person bed. The bed was uncomfortable and just very disappointed that I upgraded the room and it was worst than my last stay with base room. The next day I contacted the front desk, they were shocked that I was put in economy room and they moved all my stuff into a suite. It was kind of a two-story suite and was beautiful. Was given the "surprise me" at the front desk. At least the Hotel made an effort to correct it's mistake. Did not try the breakfast and the front desk was helpful with needs and locations of places. Side note: The last time we stayed here, we were charged for breakfast for several people over 2 days and I spent an hour upset and on the phone. The breakfast check in is based on the honor system - you just say any room number and they mark it down and you go inside. No mention of last name or any security. Beware if not eating breakfast there.
reviews.title: Upgrade if you want pleasant stay.

reviews.text: My husband and I were in Amsterdam September 2012 and stayed at the Inntel for 2 nights. The location is superb- 5 minute walk from Central station, close to Dam Square, bars, restaurants, and nightlife. Despite its central location, it still managed to be a quiet and comfortable stay. Everyone at the hotel was very pleasant and accommodating. Our flight was moved up a few hours and instead of arriving in Amsterdam around 10 am, we arrived at about 6:30 am. I thought for sure our room wouldn't be ready, but at the very least we could drop our luggage off and explore the city. Surprisingly, our room was in fact ready, which allowed us to take a nap while we waited for my sister and her husband to arrive from the States. The bed was very comfortable and I slept well. The room includes a fridge, tv, coffeemaker and free wifi. Our room was kept clean by the great housekeeping staff and the rest of the hotel was neat, clean and well-maintained. The hotel has a boutique/chic feel which I also enjoyed. If I ever return to Amsterdam, I will most assuredly stay at Inntel again!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in Amsterdam

reviews.text: I was recommended by a friend, and he was right on target. This hotel has an excellent location, staff was attentive and nice, rooms clean and very comfortable. It is right next door to a bicycle rent place, which was great, and also walking distance to the train station and all Amsterdam has to offer. It was the perfect choice!
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: i booked this hotel based on the good review but for an average of 250 euros a day it was a huge disappointment. i booked an executive double room thinking that it would be a good room, the room was very small, with basic furniture and nothing pleasant in its appearance. The hotel is in an excellent location, but it is only one of many hotels in the same location. the only satisfactory thing was the free wifi. overall it felt like an overpriced 3 star hotel
reviews.title: i would not stay there again

reviews.text: I stayed here for a week to do a gardening tour. Location is perfect, minutes to many attractions, the train station, shopping, even a grocery within walking distance. The room and bathroom was small, limited storage space, only 6 hangers. I was able to sleep well because it was off the main street. At breakfast they have a setup that you can make your own orange juice. I enjoyed it so much I will get one for myself. Service level was average. Although the hotel only has 2 elevators I never had to wait long. Overall I would recommend this hotel primarily for its location.
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pluses
reviews.title: I recommend

reviews.text: We have just returned home from a 3 night stay at this hotel. We had booked an executive room but on arrival we found it to be very small and not what I would expect from a 4* hotel. We upgraded to a business room which was a little bigger but still didnt provide anywhere for me to do my hair etc - a dressing table would have been good! The breakfast I found expensive for what was available. I found the hotel to be clean and tidy, though the sheets didn't fit on the queen size bed and the towels at times were not best ever, but they were changed daily. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful. Best of all was the location, it was excellent. Its is only a 10 minute walk to the centraal station and the canal bus. It was within walking distance to most attractions if you like a walk, if not the transport system is excellent and the trams stop almost outside the front door. I would return to this hotel
reviews.title: Excellent location, but small rooms

reviews.text: Above average for the price paid 110.00 euro per night this excluded breakfast, booked via hotels web site. 110.00 euro is a much reduced rate as the Dam is not particularly busy this time of year, it doesn’t get busy until Easter when the rates go up dramatically. Staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel was very clean. Rooms are comfortable although a little on the small side. The only difference between a "deluxe" and "superior" room is that the "superior" has one large bed, the "deluxe" rooms have two twin beds pushed together, other than that the room is exactly the same. Even at the reduced rate there is a difference of 30.00 euro for a "superior". I can understand why a couple would want one bed but don’t pay 30.00 euro + thinking that you will have a nicer room because you won’t. I would be more than happy to stay again at the reduced rate but the higher rates charged during peak times are expensive. The rooms are not “deluxe” or “superior”, however, they are comfortable and clean and you are less likely to get the rowdy crowd staying here.
reviews.title: If you can secure a good rate go for it
Liked the Golden Tulip
reviews.text: Myself and my boyfriend stayed in The Golden Tulip Inntel - Amsterdam Centre last week.
We found the staff to be friendly and the hotel in general was clean. Our room was cleaned every morning which was great as some hotels i have stayed in elsewhere would not have been cleaned daily!!
reviews.title: Definitely recommend

reviews.text: The only thing was that the room was surprisingly small! It looked alot bigger on the virtual tour on the hotel's website. The only major letdowns:
reviews.title: Great Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from 2 nights at this hotel. Being our first time in Amsterdam we wanted somewhere central to stay within walking distance of everything. On that front this hotel was perfect. Also it was clean, and we found the housekeeping staff to be very helpful and went the extra mile to provide us with extra supplies of towels and toiletries when requested.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: However, I felt that it was very expensive/overpriced for what was essentially a travel/holiday inn style hotel, and the rate which we paid did not include breakfast. The rooms were small, but as we used it as a base only this didn't bother us.
reviews.title: Great central location, good sized room, great facilities

reviews.text: All in all I would stay at this hotel again but I would hope to find it at a better rate.
reviews.title: Ideal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definately recommend this hotel. For a central European city hotel it is very clean, modern and spacious.
reviews.title: A great hotel in an excellent location

reviews.text: Great location close to central station and to shopping and restaurants. The Hotel itself is not bad even though everything in the room is build of melamine boards which is boring. But the worst thing is the lack of soundproofed material to the corridor and other rooms. It wasn't easy to fall in sleep. As a one stay on business trip it's okay.
reviews.title: Before the invention of soundproofed doors.

reviews.text: I found the hotel staff excellent and efficient. The hotel is in a great location but quiet. Great shopping area. Hotel rooms comfortable and clean and great buffet breakfast available, also free wi-fi and Internet.
reviews.title: Excellent stay, ideal location

reviews.text: We were treated excellently; arriving from the US in the late morning, they found us an available room that we could check into immediately which was great. I love the breakfast, so much variety and quality. I am a big fan of this hotel.
reviews.title: I'll be back

reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights with my boyfriend. Hotel is really nice, perfect location and easy enough to get everywhere, only a 5 minute walk from the station.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast was buffet and was good also.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: Second time I have stayed here, and again it didn't disappoint. Great location, comfortable rooms, excellent shower and bath.
reviews.title: Good quality and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is exceptionally good, and the staff are VERY friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: April 2012

reviews.text: All in all I would stay here again (third time!)
reviews.title: Location Is Everything

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is excellent for Central Amsterdam. The front desk staff was very helpful. They had maps behind the counter and were very knowledgeable about how to get around Amsterdam. The rooms were small but the beds were large and very comfortable. The hot water never ran out in the shower and this is a big plus in cold, rainy, Amsterdam. The breakfast bar was a little high priced. If you get stuck there with a tour group (which I was part of – over 100 people), the food runs out and the coffee line is way too long. There are plenty of other local choices nearby for breakfast at a better price. I would definitely ask if there are any large tour groups booked there for when you plan on staying. Our group of over 100 people clogged up the elevators, breakfast bar, lobby and lounge for days. Elevators only hold 3 or 4 people with luggage at a time. Imagine how long 100 people with luggage take to get up the elevator. Very frustrating to say the least. We will stay here again, without the group. Room service is from Humphrey’s next door. Very good.
reviews.title: Ok Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's hard to imagine a better location, with all transit easily walkable and the heart of the city nearby, yet the hotel itself pretty quiet. The rooms are small but clean and nicely modern, and who spends all their time in Amsterdam in their room. Search for the best price; rates seem to fluctuate depending on the booking source. I found the staff friendly and extremely helpful. Hardly a "grand hotel", but efficient and ideally situated.
reviews.title: Weekend in Amsterdam

reviews.text: Excellent hotel located in the centre of Amsterdam and only 5-10 minutes walk to Central station so it is very convenient for the rail and metro network to get to other location especially the Rai exhibition centre. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. The bars next door 'Humphreys' is excellent and serve excellent food at a good price. All in all a good place to stay if you are ever in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in Central Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not too cheap, but you get quality for your money. The room was clean and bright, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was good too. The location was also great, almost everything is in walking distance. I like to eat a lot for breakfast and it was perfect for me, you can choose from a wide-range of foods and drinks, any type you can want for breakfast. I only had one problem: in the web-page they told me the room is equiped with a hairdryer, but it was not. I would have brought one if I knew I would need it.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is currently a little difficult to get to via taxi as the main road that the hotel is located on is currently under construction. The hotel however is brilliantly located as it is central to almost everything that you would want to see/experience in Amsterdam. On arrival, the staff was friendly and assisted my girlfriend and I instantaneously. When we had checked in, the room was reasonably modern however the bathroom had been a little dated. There was no view from the window whatsoever. The hotel is located near Dam Square which means that the ringing of the bells at Dam Square can be heard quite often. The room service/snacks were impressive however extremely pricey. There are many coffee shops as well as the Red Light District that is very close to the hotel. Do not use the hotel telephone as we had made 5 calls to South African mobile telephones from the hotel for roughly 3-4 minutes and had been charged 140 Euro!! Insane? You bet! When we had arrived back in South Africa, we had realised that the hotel also charged us an additional 73 Euro as a holding charge but was never refunded. I have emailed them however there has been no response. I will call them shortly to rectify the problem. All in the hotel the hotel was great and we enjoyed it. If you do decide to stay at the hotel, do enjoy your stay! Hope this review helps.
reviews.title: September 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a 2 night get away and I can only say WOW, this is my 4th time staying in Amsterdam and I didnt think that a nice hotel existed, we were upgraded on arrival for free, beds were sooo comfy... didnt want to leave... the hotel is right in the centre of all things good.... shopping, food, bars, coffee shops, dam square etc.. Central station is 5 minute walk away, I cannot recommend this hotel enough... will definitely be booking here on my next visit to Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Friendly Staff, Super Hotel,

reviews.text: I would give Inntel 5/5 for service starting with the booking process and ending with check out. The concierge booked me two restaurants in advance and the restaurants were expecting us when we arrived. The front desk staff were very helpful,organising a discounted boat trip and providing information. The rooms were adequate but perfectly comfortable. I was not too keen on the photographs of "real" Amsterdam people appearing on the bedroom walls but art is very subjective isn't it. I didn't take breakfast as I prefer to eat in off site cafes but the dining room looked quite good. The bar area is quite cosy, not sterile as you find in some large hotels. Amsterdam is not an expensive place to eat and drink in but I felt the room tariff was slightly on the high side even though I negotiated for 5 rooms. They were 158.50 euros per night plus 5% city tax. However, this was reasonably competitive and unless you find a good B&B you should expect to pay at least this, even in late September. The location is good and it was quiet at night.
reviews.title: Great service, adequate rooms

aka: Inntel Hotels Amsterdam Centre Hotel Amsterdam
description: Inntel Hotels Amsterdam-Centre is situated in the historical heart of the city. Within walking distance you'll find many shopping streets and department stores. Because of the unique location at traffic free square, we can guarantee an undisturbed goodnight sleep. All air-conditioned rooms are modern and warm decorated. Always need access to the Internet? The hotel offers FREE WiFi.
